simplesect.para: HAL must remain valid for the lifetime of the Driver
Driver is constructed but not initialized

detaileddescription.para:
Performs complete initialization sequence:
Initialize HAL (SPI peripheral)
Verify device communication
Read and verify device ID
Apply default configuration (in Config Mode)
Clear any power-on faults
After init(), device is in Config Mode. Call enter_mission_mode() to enable outputs.
Transitions from Config Mode to Mission Mode. Channel outputs can only be enabled in Mission Mode. Most configuration registers can only be written in Config Mode.
Transitions from Mission Mode to Config Mode. All channel outputs are automatically disabled when entering Config Mode.

simplesect.para: true if in mission mode, false if in config mode

parameterdescription.para: true to enable, false to disable
Bitmask where bit N enables channel N

memberdef.argsstring: (Channel channel, uint16_t current_ma, bool parallel_mode=false) noexcept
memberdef.name: set_current_setpoint

parameterdescription.para: Desired current in milliamperes (0-2000 single, 0-4000 parallel)
Set true if channel is in parallel mode

simplesect.para: Current is regulated by the Integrated Current Controller (ICC)
Resolution: 15-bit (0.061mA per LSB in single mode)

listitem.para: Single channel: 1.5A typical continuous, 2.0A absolute maximum
Parallel channels: 2.7A typical continuous, 4.0A absolute maximum

simplesect.para: Setting currents above typical continuous ratings may result in thermal limiting, reduced accuracy, or current regulation at the device's natural limit rather than the requested setpoint.

parameterdescription.para: true if channel is in parallel mode

simplesect.para: DriverResult<uint16_t> Current in mA or error

memberdef.argsstring: (Channel channel, uint8_t period_mantissa, uint8_t period_exponent, bool low_freq_range=false) noexcept
memberdef.name: configure_pwm_period

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Channel to configure
period_mantissa
PWM period mantissa
period_exponent
PWM period exponent (0-7)
low_freq_range
Enable low frequency range (8x multiplier)
DriverResult<void> Success or error
PWM period: t_PWM = mantissa * 2^exponent * (1/f_sys) If low_freq_range: t_PWM = mantissa * 8 * 2^exponent * (1/f_sys)

memberdef.argsstring: (Channel channel, uint16_t step_size, uint8_t num_steps, uint8_t flat_steps) noexcept
memberdef.name: configure_dither

parameterdescription.para: Number of steps in quarter period
Number of flat clock cycles at top/bottom

briefdescription.para: Configure channel slew rate and diagnostics.
Get average current for a channel.

simplesect.para: DriverResult<uint16_t> Average current in mA or error

briefdescription.para: Get PWM duty cycle for a channel.

simplesect.para: DriverResult<uint16_t> VBAT in millivolts or error
DriverResult<uint16_t> VIO in millivolts or error

detaileddescription.para: Clears latched fault conditions. Does not clear active faults.

simplesect.para: DriverResult<bool> true if any fault exists

detaileddescription.para: Resets all registers to default values. init() must be called again.
Must be called periodically when SPI watchdog is enabled to prevent watchdog timeout.

briefdescription.para: Verify device ID matches expected value.

parameterdescription.para: If true, verify CRC in response

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t address, uint16_t value, bool verify_crc=true) noexcept
memberdef.name: write_register

parameterdescription.para: If true, verify CRC in response

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t address, uint16_t mask, uint16_t value) noexcept
memberdef.name: modify_register

briefdescription.para: Transfer SPI frame with CRC calculation and verification.
Parse SPI status from reply frame.
Check if channel is currently in parallel mode.

simplesect.para: DriverResult<bool> true if channel is paralleled, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: This is the primary driver class that provides complete control over the TLE92466ED IC. It manages SPI communication (32-bit with CRC), configuration, current control, monitoring, and diagnostics for all six output channels.
Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe by default. External synchronization is required for multi-threaded access.
Resource Management: Uses RAII principles - init() must be called explicitly but cleanup is automatic.
Error Handling: Uses std::expected for robust error handling without exceptions.

listitem.para: Call init() to initialize hardware and verify device
Call enter_mission_mode() to enable channel control
Configure channels with set_channel_mode() and configure_channel()
